page.title: 04Talkin Tarn Country Park.
page.content: In 1970, Cumbria County Council bought 160 acres of woodland and farmland which included 65 acres of water - Talkin Tarn. In 1972 this became a Country Park. The Tarn is 42ft (12.2m) at its deepest point and is fed from underwater springs. The distance around the Tarn is 1+1/3 miles. This beautiful area is well wooded with excellent views of the fells in the near distance. The fields are leased to farmers for grazing. Nature lovers find plenty of interest in the bird, animal and plant life. As well as local people, between 60 and 70{thousand}visitors come annually from Carlisle and towns in the North East. A full time Warden and assistant are employed there.
